article:
Mr. Clinton and his 3-year-old son Tony are basketball fans. Last October 10th was Tony's birthday, so Mr. Clinton decided to _ him to New York, for the first game of the World Series. They had no ticket but hoped to buy a _ from scalpers.
It was a two hours' ride. After they arrived, they walked in the street for two hours, carrying a _ that read, " We need two tickets." There were many scalpers around, but the _ ticket was $200. They were about to _ when suddenly a man stopped them. He took out two tickets and _ them to Mr. Clinton.
"How much do you want?"
"Just a _ ," said the man. "Enjoy the game."
Mr. Clinton wouldn't accept, so the man explained, "I'm Jackson. Hans is my boss. He and his wife haven't _ a World Series in 18 years. _ he is ill and can't watch the game this time. So he told me to give the two tickets to people who I thought would actually enjoy the game. A lot of people looked as if they might just take the tickets and sell them. Then I saw you and I _ you for a while. You seemed very _ . You made me think of my dad and me when I was a child. I dreamed _ going to a World Series game with my father. But my dream _ came true."
How do you suppose this made Mr. Clinton and his son feel? Here is what Mr. Clinton said: "This is the most wonderful thing _ ever happened to us. My boy and I must have turned to each other over 30 times and said, 'I can't believe this.' We still never forget Jackson and Hans."
